result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles C Shouse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles C Shouse is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles C Shouse was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Charles C Shouse was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.

AS OF 5/24/2016: Huber was granted
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attend Victim Impact Panel meeting - 11/18/2015 or 20 days alternate consecutive.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $215.00.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD COSTS. To be forwarded to the Waukesha County Sheriff's dept.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Provide DNA sample if not yet previously done.
Not to operate MV unless properly licensed.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonworking hours, with standard release.
Perform 50 hours at a rate of $10.00 per hour to help offset fine/costs.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
From WCS dated 10/23/15 re non-compliance of the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 09:30 am
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Charles C Shouse in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Court will not modify bail at this time. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date in 45 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on behalf of Judge Aprahamian - address at 9/14/15 hearing.
Hearing on September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court.   Defendant Charles C Shouse did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. WCS letter addressed.   Warrant addressed. Atty. Kuhary requests to have bond reinstated and warrant quashed. Court orders warrant quashed. Bail was not ordered forfeited. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Treatment letter filed by WCS.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian on 8/2/15.

Non-compliance with WCS.
Branch 9 Only.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on August 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program and be on enhanced supervision.   Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Charles C Shouse in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
